Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as many of the images included in the collection are not from the wildfires in Australia.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that many of the images are not from the Australian wildfires.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent of the impact on animals by stating that over 480 million animals have been killed, which is an estimate from the University of Sydney.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the collection of photos accurately represents the animals caught in the Australia wildfires, which is not the case.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim presents alternative explanations for the origin of some of the photos, such as the tiger on fire image from Jakarta, Indonesia in 2012.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by including photos that are not related to the Australian wildfires, thereby misleading the audience.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the provided claim.
